greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest multiplier of n! such that -1+a(n)*n! and 1+a(n)*n! are both primes.
link: Pierre CAMI, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..300
mathematica: Table[fl=1; Do[s=(j!)*k; If[PrimeQ[s-1]&&PrimeQ[s+1]&&Equal[fl, 1], Print[{j, k}]; fl=0], {k, 1, 2*j^2}], {j, 0, 100}]
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, May 24 2002
